meanings.sent1: The teacher accidentally misgraded the math test.
meanings.sent2: It is important not to misgrade students' assignments.
meanings.sent3: The computer misgraded the quiz and gave everyone a perfect score.
meanings.sent4: Her perception of reality was misgraded, leading to confusion.
meanings.sent5: The misgraded report caused unnecessary stress for the students.

meanings.definition: A grade or evaluation that is incorrect.
meanings.sent1: She was disappointed to receive a misgrade on her essay.
meanings.sent2: The misgrade on his report affected his overall GPA.
meanings.sent3: The misgrade in the system caused chaos during registration.
meanings.sent4: The misgrade felt like a slap in the face after all her hard work.
meanings.sent5: The student was relieved when the misgrade was corrected.
